title: '{NAME}' chart values - version '{VERSION}'
description:
ℹ️ Learn how to use this chart: [How-to guide](https://blablacar.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CD/pages/3129606193/How+to+use+Base+Helm+chart) ℹ️

You can reference this schema **in your HelmRelease** by adding this at the very top:
`# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://bbc-helm-charts.storage.googleapis.com/{NAME}/{VERSION}/helmRelease.schema.json`

and **in your application chart values** with:
`# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://bbc-helm-charts.storage.googleapis.com/{NAME}/{VERSION}/values.schema.json`
*In order to have completion for your application chart values in HelmRelease, please refer to this [documentation](https://blablacar.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CD/pages/3129606193/How+to+use+Base+Helm+chart#Values-properties-completion)*

checkRequiredValues.title: Check required values to make some fields mandatory on HelmRelease by looking for null values and fail rendering if found

global.title: Set things that will apply to all generated resources

legacyLabelSelector.title: Enable the legacy selector label (app) for workloads only. Disabled by default

revisionTag.title: The control plane revision tag
revisionTag.description: This revision tag identify the control plane which validate the resources

chartDefaults.title: Configure default behavior of the chart when a new resource or a feature is enabled

debug.title: Allow debug of generated values.
debug.description: When enabled, a configmap named RELEASE-NAME-debug containing all rendered values is included in resources

kubeClusterName.title: Name of the Kubernetes cluster the Chart gets deployed to.
kubeClusterName.description: This value is typically set in kube-manifests, and there is automation in place to enforce its presence.

teamShortname.title: Team's shortname owning resources.
teamShortname.description:
Must match shortname from terraform's common team definition at:
# Mandatory to be set and will be applied as label on each resource
# [[ref]](https://github.com/blablacar/terraform-configs/tree/master/common)

mainWorkload.title: definition of the main workload. This is a shortcut to workloads.main:

workloads.title: Render some workloads, indexed by an identifier

^[0-9a-z-]*$.title: Identifier of the workload
^[0-9a-z-]*$.description: All resources created for this workload will have the same identifier as this workload
